title: Ham Bone and Vegetable Soup Recipe
description: This ham bone soup makes perfect use of a leftover ham bone; it's easy to make in a slow cooker with loads of veggies and chunks of ham for a cozy meal.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Pork Soup Recipes Ham Soup Hearty Ham Bone Soup 4.7 (77) 67 Reviews 6 Photos This easy ham bone soup makes good use of leftover holiday ham. I always add the three basics: onion, celery, and carrots. In addition, you can add a variety of different vegetables to suit your taste or use what you have in the house at the time. Submitted by Gayle Satre Updated on March 20, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs 20 mins Total Time: 4 hrs 30 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 tablespoons bacon grease 1 large onion, diced 2 carrots, peeled and diced 3 stalks celery, diced 2 cloves garlic, crushed 3 medium potatoes, diced 8 cups hot water 8 cubes chicken bouillon 1 ham bone 1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes ½ (16 ounce) package frozen corn 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce 1 teaspoon black pepper or to taste pinch of salt or to taste Directions Melt bacon grease in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion, carrots, celery, and garlic in hot bacon grease until vegetables are slightly tender and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Stir potatoes into onion mixture; cook and stir until golden, about 10 minutes. Stir hot water and chicken bouillon together in a slow cooker until bouillon is dissolved; add onion mixture, ham bone, diced tomatoes, corn, tomato sauce, black pepper, and salt. Cook soup in the slow cooker set to Low for 4 to 6 hours. Remove ham bone from soup and let rest until cool enough to handle. Remove meat from ham bone and stir meat into soup. I Made It Print 185 home cooks made it! name: Gayle Satre
instructions: Melt bacon grease in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion, carrots, celery, and garlic in hot bacon grease until vegetables are slightly tender and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Stir potatoes into onion mixture; cook and stir until golden, about 10 minutes.;Stir hot water and chicken bouillon together in a slow cooker until bouillon is dissolved; add onion mixture, ham bone, diced tomatoes, corn, tomato sauce, black pepper, and salt.;Cook soup in the slow cooker set to Low for 4 to 6 hours. Remove ham bone from soup and let rest until cool enough to handle. Remove meat from ham bone and stir meat into soup.
